name: ITPS-013 Electric Fire Pumpset Installation and Commissioning
template name: ITPS-013 Electric Fire Pumpset Installation and Commissioning

name: 1 - Check location of pumpset - in a position that is protected from falling debris, and vehicular and mechanical damage
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA SPECIFIED - AS2941.1-2013 – Section 11 Installation
2 - Check clearence of pumpset - For ongoing inspection and testing, a clearance of not less than 1.0 m shall be provided around the perimeter of a complete pump assembly;
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA SPECIFIED - AS2941.1-2013 – Section 11 Installation
3 - Check clearence of pumpset - for multiple pumpset installations, a clearance of not less than 600 mm between each of the installed pumps shall be provided
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA SPECIFIED - AS2941.1-2013 – Section 11 Installation

4 - Check elevations - Multiple pumpsets shall be installed with the centre-line of all suction pipes at the same elevation. If the pumps are to be installed at different elevations, the elevated pump shall be installed on a properly constructed mezzanine floor with head clearance of minimum 2.1 m to the underside on both levels
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA SPECIFIED - AS2941.1-2013 – Section 11 Installation

5 - Check Plinth - Pumpset baseplates shall be mounted on concrete plinths with a height not less than 150 mm above the floor. For fixing purposes, the concrete plinth shall extend 150 mm past the edge of the baseplate on all four sides.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA SPECIFIED - AS2941.1-2013 – Section 11 Installation
6a - Check the coupling alignment to ensure that the unit is aligned within the manufacturer’s specified tolerance.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA SPECIFIED - AS2941.1-2013 – Section 11 and 12
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA SPECIFIED - AS2941.1-2013 – Section 11 and 12
6c - Ensure that the delivery from the pump under test is the only supply to the measuring device and that all flow from the pump passes through the device.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA SPECIFIED - AS2941.1-2013 – Section 11 and 12
6d - Ensure that the pump is primed and that lines are clear, valves correctly set (open, closed or adjusted to required pressure), and that water is available.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA SPECIFIED - AS2941.1-2013 – Section 11 and 12
6e - Isolate all other water supplies to the fire protection systems, such as the automatic pressure maintenance pump and compression-ignition engine driven pumps
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA SPECIFIED - AS2941.1-2013 – Section 11 Installation
7a - The following shall be reported – Pump plate details / photo
7b - Record - the pressure in the system at which the pump starts automatically.
7c - Record - Pump shut-off pressure on delivery gauge
7d - Record - Motor current at shut-off pressure.
7e - Record - Delivery pressure at maximum flow
7f - Record - Pressure on discharge gauge and motor current at three other flow rates between shutoff and maximum flow, one of which should be at the duty flow rate
(i) periodically check the temperature of the bearings and stuffing box leakage and note any abnormality;
(ii) check that all alarms and indicators, both visual and aural, have been activated; and
(iii) check that alarms and indicators, both visual and aural, revert to normal stand-by status when pump is stopped.
8 - Whether the electric pumpset, together with its associated control gear and ancillary equipment, functioned correctly.
9 - Whether the pumpset satisfies the intended performance conditions (e.g. flow rate and head).
ITPS-014 Diesel Fire Pumpset Installation and Commissioning
template name: ITPS-014 Diesel Fire Pumpset Installation and Commissioning

name: 1 - Check location of pumpset - in a position that is protected from falling debris, and vehicular and mechanical damage
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA SPECIFIED - AS2941.1-2013 – Section 11 Installation
2 - Check clearance of pumpsets - For ongoing inspection and testing, a clearance of not less than 1.0 m shall be provided around the perimeter of a complete pump assembly;
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA SPECIFIED - AS2941.1-2013 – Section 11 Installation
3 - Check clearence of pumpset - for multiple pumpset installations, a clearance of not less than 600 mm between each of the installed pumps shall be provided
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA SPECIFIED - AS2941.1-2013 – Section 11 Installation

4 - Check elevations - Multiple pumpsets shall be installed with the centre-line of all suction pipes at the same elevation. If the pumps are to be installed at different elevations, the elevated pump shall be installed on a properly constructed mezzanine floor with head clearance of minimum 2.1 m to the underside on both levels
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA SPECIFIED - AS2941.1-2013 – Section 11 Installation

5 - Check Plinth - Pumpset baseplates shall be mounted on concrete plinths with a height not less than 150 mm above the floor. For fixing purposes, the concrete plinth shall extend 150 mm past the edge of the baseplate on all four sides.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA SPECIFIED - AS2941.1-2013 – Section 11 Installation
6a - Check the – Check the cooling supply system
6b - Check the – Check engine fuel supply
6c - Check the – coupling alignment to ensure that the unit is aligned within the manufacturer’s specified tolerance
6e - Check – Engine lubricating oil is at the correct level. Check – the battery electrolyte level and the battery leads and connections. Check – exhaust system is intact
6f - Ensure – pump is primed and that lines are clear, valves correctly set (open, closed, or adjusted to required pressure), and that water is available.
6g - Isolate – all other water supplies to the fire protection systems, such as the automatic pressure maintenance pump and any other compression-ignition engine driven pumps in the system.
7a - Record – For automatic starting pumpsets, record the pressure in the system at which the pump starts automatically.
7d - Check – That the fan is rotating and all fan belts are intact

7f - Isolate – the flow meter, partially open the test valve, and flush to remove any debris or foreign matter; open any meter-isolating valves, open the test valve, and record pump delivery gauge pressure when approximately full load flow is indicated on the flow meter.
8 - Run the pump for 30 min at maximum flow and record the following:
(ii) Engine running temperature, which shall be within the engine manufacturer’s recommended limits.
(iii) Engine oil pressure, which shall be within the engine manufacturer’s limits.
(v) Discharge pressure at three other flow rates between shut-off and maximum flow, one of which shall be at the duty flow rate.

(vi) Check that the requirements of Clause 9.3.6.2 are complied with by holding the engine shutdown mechanism closed and simulating an automatic start signal until the engine has attempted to start for five automatic starting cycles. On the sixth starting cycle, return the engine shutdown mechanism to its normal starting position and check if the engine starts immediately.
(A) periodically check temperature of the bearings and stuffing box leakage and note any abnormality;
(B) check that all alarms and indicators, both visual and aural, have been activated; and

(C) check that alarms and indicators, both visual and aural, revert to normal stand-by status when pump is stopped. If the pump failed to start alarms that are fitted on the pump fire pump controller and at the remote station, check that these alarms operate both aurally and visually.
(j) Shut down and restore starting mechanism to stand-by status.
(k) Restore power supply to the electric pumps and check correct status of indicators.

ITPS-016 Fire and EWIS Panel Installation
template name: ITPS-016 Fire and EWIS Panel Installation

name: (i) Installed in a location protected by the FDAS (expect where external to building)
(ii) Operation of FIP shall not affect evacuation of building
(iii) Located in an area which presents low risk of damage to equipment and persons
(iv) Not mounted in any rooms containing sprinkler, pumps or motors
(i) Have controls and indicators not less than 750mm and not more than 1850mm above floor level.
(ii) Have unobstructed access to controls and indicators
(iii) Be mounted above ground level to protect batteries/on a plinth
Check – Where the FIP is obscured by a door ensure the words “FIRE PANEL” in letters not less than 50mm high. There SHALL be no other lettering on the door.
Check – Clearance. 1000mm in front of FIP and 500mm to each side shall be maintained.
Zone Block Plan – Installation shall be securely mounted and easily accessible.
Manual Call point – Manual call point must be installed at the entry point to site if the FIP is not located close to that point.
Check – Power cabling is installed at FIP location
Check – Location strobe on front of building is installed and operational.
